Metadata

Source: vignettes/Metadata.Rmd
Metadata.Rmd

This short article will showcase the usage of metadata with STATcubeR. For this, we start with the same example as in the README file.

json_path <- sc_example("bev_seit_1982.json")
my_response <- sc_table(json_path)

Now, sc_meta() can be used to get metadata about the table.

sc_meta(my_response)
## $database
##                                                label         code
## 1 Population at the beginning of the year since 1982 debevstandjb
## 
## $measures
##    label     code fun precision
## 1 Number F-ISIS-1 SUM         0
## 
## $fields
##              label        code nitems        type
## 1     Time section     C-A10-0     40 Time (year)
## 2       Bundesland    C-BB00-0     11    Category
## 3 Country of birth C-GEBLAND-0      3    Category

In order to get more detailed metadata about a certain filed, use sc_meta_field().

sc_meta_field(my_response, 2)
##                   label code               parsed
## 1     Burgenland <AT11>    1    Burgenland <AT11>
## 2      Carinthia <AT21>    2     Carinthia <AT21>
## 3  Lower Austria <AT12>    3 Lower Austria <AT12>
## 4  Upper Austria <AT31>    4 Upper Austria <AT31>
## 5       Salzburg <AT32>    5      Salzburg <AT32>
## 6         Styria <AT22>    6        Styria <AT22>
## 7          Tyrol <AT33>    7         Tyrol <AT33>
## 8     Vorarlberg <AT34>    8    Vorarlberg <AT34>
## 9         Vienna <AT13>    9        Vienna <AT13>
## 10 Not classifiable <0>    0 Not classifiable <0>
## 11                Total                      <NA>
